image.altText: Side-by-side portraits of Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews and his deputy Jacinta Allan taken at separate events in 2023.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Deputy Premier Jacinta Allan confirms she'll run for the state's top job, after long-time leader Daniel Andrews's sudden resignation. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Daniel Andrews's deputy tipped as likely replacement after surprise resignation

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Deputy Premier confirms she'll be running for the top job, but won't be making further comment before tomorrow's caucus meeting.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Jacinta Allan confirms she's running to be Victoria's next premier

children.content: The Deputy Premier confirms she'll be running for the top job, but won't be making further comment before tomorrow's caucus meeting.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Opposition Leader John Pesutto opens by acknowledging Daniel Andrews and his years of political service. "I do take this opportunity to wish Mr Andrews well with his family and all that he does in the future," he says. But he then pivots to say that Mr Andrews is standing down because things in Victoria are "falling apart". "The legacy that Daniel Andrews leaves is a state that is broken," he says. "Victoria is broken, we know it, we see the evidence of it every day." He lists the intergenerational burden of state debt and interest repayments and state taxes as legacies of the outgoing premier.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Daniel Andrews leaves a Victoria that is 'falling apart', opposition says

children.content: opens by acknowledging Daniel Andrews and his years of political service.
"I do take this opportunity to wish Mr Andrews well with his family and all that he does in the future," he says.
But he then pivots to say that Mr Andrews is standing down because things in Victoria are "falling apart".
"The legacy that Daniel Andrews leaves is a state that is broken," he says.
"Victoria is broken, we know it, we see the evidence of it every day."
He lists the intergenerational burden of state debt and interest repayments and state taxes as legacies of the outgoing premier.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Tomorrow at midday the Labor caucus will meet to discuss a successor to Daniel Andrews. He's said he won't be meddling in party politics and will leave it to his colleagues to choose a new leader. Deputy Premier Jacinta Allan, a political mentee of Mr Andrews and also part of Labor's Socialist Left faction, is largely seen as his heir apparent. Public Transport Minister Ben Carroll, from Labor's Right faction, is also in the mix, with speculation he'll run for the position of deputy.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Who might replace Daniel Andrews?

children.content: Tomorrow at midday the Labor caucus will meet to discuss a successor to Daniel Andrews.
He's said he won't be meddling in party politics and will leave it to his colleagues to choose a new leader.
, a political mentee of Mr Andrews and also part of Labor's Socialist Left faction, is largely seen as his heir apparent.

props.alt: Jacinta Allan at a press conference.

children.content: Jacinta Allan is the Labor MP for Bendigo East and likely successor.
, from Labor's Right faction, is also in the mix, with speculation he'll run for the position of deputy.
Ben Carroll is tipped to run as deputy leader of the party.

image.altText: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews punches the air, surrounded by his wife and two adult children.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Premier will formally step down from the role at 5pm on Wednesday after announcing his resignation.

title.children: Daniel Andrews thanks family, supporters as he announces end to nine-year stint as premier

image.altText: Daniel Andrews makes a hand gesture at a press conference. He is outdoors

props.synopsis: There is no other political figure who has towered over Victorian and National politics quite like Daniel Andrews, defying his critics and prevailing at times when his opponents were writing him off, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Love him or loathe him, Andrews walks away as a leader who could not be vanquished

image.altText: A man with glasses and a navy blue suit and tie stands behind a lecturn at a business conference

props.synopsis: The Australian Shareholders' Association has joined the growing chorus of calls demanding Qantas' chairman Richard Goyder resign from his position, and has placed the rest of the airline's board on notice after weeks of scandals.

title.children: Qantas shareholders demand chairman's resignation as board put on notice

image.altText: plan landing on tarmac with wheel down and cityscape in the background

props.synopsis: Brisbane Airport Corporation tells a Senate inquiry the the government's rejection of Qatar Airways' bid to fly more services to Australia is driving up airfares and undermining tourism.

title.children: Two of Australia's biggest airports call for government to review Qatar Airways decision

image.altText: Mundine stands behind a lectern, a large blue screen with the press club logo behind him.

props.synopsis: Leading No campaigner Nyunggai Warren Mundine has labelled the Uluru Statement from the Heart "a symbolic declaration of war" at the National Press Club today.

title.children: Leading No campaigner Nyunggai Warren Mundine says Uluru Statement 'symbolic declaration of war'

image.altText: Several adults surround and hold down a boy in a padded room. The adults are wearing helmets.

props.synopsis: Disability advocates say better regulation of NDIS service providers is needed after an ABC investigation uncovered "sickening" practices used against children with disabilities, which included unlawfully pinning young people to the ground facedown as part of a controversial therapy.

title.children: Advocates call for tighter regulation after 'sickening' practices used against children with disabilities

image.altText: A ute being driven down a gravel road between tall pine trees.

props.synopsis: Automotive brands are being accused of pushing a "loophole" policy so they can keep selling dirty and inefficient vehicles to Australian consumers.

title.children: Why Australia's fuel efficiency debate is all coming down to our love of 4WDs and utes

image.altText: Tigist Assefa holds up the Adidas Adizerio Adios Pro Evo 1 running shoe

props.synopsis: Adidas' new running shoe helped Ethiopia's Tigst Assefa take more than two minutes off the marathon world record in Berlin at the weekend — but if you want to get hold of the the one-run-and-done shoe, you'd better start saving.

title.children: Adidas enters the sporting arms race with a stunning shoe with an equally stunning price-tag

image.altText: Immigration Department Secretary Mike Pezzullo fronts Senate estimates on May 22, 2017

props.synopsis: He's wielded unrivalled power for decades. A one-time Labor staffer turned senior bureaucrat who lobbied for hardline border policies, Michael Pezzullo has won favour and hatred in equal measures from politicians across the ideological spectrum.

title.children: Infamously compared to a cockroach, former political powerbroker Mike Pezzullo is suddenly looking mortal

image.altText: Penguins on a iceberg.

props.synopsis: Sea ice that packs the ocean around Antarctica hit record low levels this winter, adding to scientists' fears the impact of climate change at the southern pole is ramping up.

title.children: Antarctic winter sea ice hits 'extreme' record low

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie sits at a table for an interview on Kitchen Cabinet

props.synopsis: One of the Coalition's most senior politicians says the way her government treated former Australia Post boss Christine Holgate was a defining moment for when women turned away from the Liberal-National government.

title.children: 'Humiliating personally and professionally': Bridget McKenzie opens up about losing her dream job

image.altText: A blurry aerial photograph shows a large alligator lying on the back of a truck as two men prepare to place a tarpaulin over it.

props.synopsis: The daughter of a woman found dead in the jaws of an alligator in the US state of Florida has spoken out about the "unbearable pain" faced by her family as they deal with the loss of a loved one as well as internet rumours about the nature of her death.

title.children: 'My mother didn't taunt it': Florida woman, 41, identified as body found in jaws of alligator

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses and a racecar driver's outfit.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Terence "Rio" Nugara concede he was "motivated by greed" when he fleeced investors of their life savings and spent it on his luxury lifestyle.

title.children: 'Greedy' financial adviser spent clients' money on helicopters and cars, court hears

image.altText: A woman carrying a jacket and another woman walk alongside building.

props.synopsis: A Townsville mum warned her sons "she would call the police" if they ended up at the Ross River unsupervised again, a court has heard. They drowned the next day.

title.children: 'They were warned': Court hears mum 'ferociously scolded' sons day before river drowning

image.altText: A four-wheel-drive police car on a dusty limestone track surrounded by arid scrub.

props.synopsis: Most regional police cars in WA will have new satellite technology to provide constant communications access by the end of next year.

title.children: Satellite technology means no more mobile phone black spots for police

image.altText: A car submerged in the ocean with just the roof showing

props.synopsis: Police find human remains inside a vehicle in a small town north of Perth as they continue to investigate potential links between a car fire, a sea rescue and another vehicle found submerged in the ocean.

title.children: Human remains found in car as police investigate baffling series of events in small WA town

image.altText: A young man sits on a couch in a black and white photo.

props.synopsis: McCallum, who was also a musician and was sampled by Dr Dre, dies of natural causes while surrounded by family at New York Presbyterian Hospital.

title.children: David McCallum, star of hit TV series The Man From U.N.C.L.E. and NCIS, dies aged 90

image.altText: lachie neale enters the training field surrounded by fans smiling

props.synopsis: Surrounded by supporters in Springfield, the two-time Brownlow Medal winner thanked fans for their 'passion and energy'.

title.children: Fresh off his second Brownlow win, Lachie Neale didn’t mince words on home soil

image.altText: A woman wearing shorts and a T-shirt standing in front of a fence with a pensive expression.

props.synopsis: Obesity experts and patient groups are concerned an over-reliance on body mass index (BMI) is leading to some people being abandoned by the health system and denied life-changing surgery or treatment.

title.children: Belinda could barely walk, but was told to lose weight for life-changing knee replacement surgery

image.altText: A 14-year-old boy screams, sitting on the floor as two men whose faces are blurred push him.

props.synopsis: Children with autism spent hours with staff in padded rooms, where they were sometimes sat on and held down by adults as part of a controversial NDIS-funded therapy.

title.children: Jadon wouldn't sit on a cushion, so staff in 'Severe Behaviour' shirts stepped in to force him

image.altText: A green aurora in the sky and is also reflected off the beach with a snowy mountain in the background

props.synopsis: A awe-inspiring image of a oxygen arc next to the Andromeda Galaxy has placed first out of 4,000 entries from 64 countries.

title.children: Galaxies, planets, and new discoveries: Here are the winning images from Astronomy Photographer of the Year

image.altText: man smiling without a shirt on

props.synopsis: A jury hears a frantic emergency call made by a woman trying to save the life of a man allegedly stabbed to death by Raymond Allen, 41, on the New South Wales South Coast.

title.children: Jury hears neighbour's desperate triple-0 call following alleged caravan park murder

image.altText: A woman sits looks directly into the camera while sitting in a lounge room.

props.synopsis: Pauline Weldon-Bowen takes legal action against NSW Police Force claiming she was discriminated against because of her race and gender, in a case her lawyer says highlights a culture of unconscious bias.

title.children: Sydney woman sues police over how she was treated when she reported an alleged road rage

image.altText: Three women stand outside in a tight embrace

props.synopsis: Tasmania's children have been abused in the government's institutions — from hospitals to schools — and failed by a state response that has "too often been inadequate", a long-awaited report finds.

title.children: Children 'disbelieved' as decades of sexual abuse allowed to continue in Tasmania's institutions, report finds

image.altText: Kim Jong Un leans over a table, looking through a magnifier as he points a gun.

props.synopsis: While its northern rival has a nuclear vessel at its disposal, South Korea is relying on another strategy to scare its neighbours: an elite special forces operation unit trained to work behind enemy lines. Here's how it works.

title.children: If Kim Jong Un declares war, South Korea's 'decapitation unit' triggers the 'kill chain'

image.altText: A balding man in a blue suit, no tie, arm-in-arm, with a woman in a dark red plung dress.

props.synopsis: Emma Heming Willis says dementia "is a family disease" that has ripple effects for the person diagnosed and their loved ones.

title.children: Bruce Willis's wife says 'it's hard to know' if he is aware of his dementia

image.altText: three politicians smiling

props.synopsis: Former NSW Minister Gareth Ward has blamed "wrong" information after he held a press conference to announce funding he had already announced four years ago.

title.children: Gareth Ward 'furious' after announcing old airport funding for second time

image.altText: A cut out of George Clooney in front of an infinity pool

props.synopsis: A multi-million-dollar holiday home which once hosted movie star George Clooney has been destroyed by fire that took emergency services several hours to extinguish.

title.children: Luxury home with star-studded history burns down on Hamilton Island

image.altText: A man lies in hospital with a tube coming from his nose

props.synopsis: Efforts are underway to save the Gold Coast surfing champion who is critically ill in a Bali hospital.

title.children: Rush on for rare blood donations to help save surfing great Mark Richardson

image.altText: Sydney Swan's Luke Parker and wife Kate Lawrence-Parker arrive at the 2023 Brownlow Awards.

props.synopsis: Highlighter pink, glittering golds and iridescent purples dominated the red carpet at the 2023 Brownlow Medal awards.

title.children: Brownlow Medal 2023: The outfits on the red carpet as the AFL crowns its best and fairest
